class research.files.File(*args, **kwargs)¶

File model is used to keep track of grouping information as well as the binary tree order.

class research.files.Item(*args, **kwargs)¶

Item model is used only to keep track of all files created during session. Used with manager.burn() to remove all files.

DoesNotExist¶

alias of ItemDoesNotExist

Master submodule¶

exception research.master.CannotSplit(message=None)¶

Used to indicate you cannot split the matrix due to size constraints.

class research.master.Part(filename, ext, q, shape, a_elems)¶

Object used as proxy to pass named information to manager.

research.master.create_b_of_g(b, order)¶

Create new B of a grouping.

Parameters:
  • b (numpy.array) – B from parent matrix
  • order (list of int) – ordering of elements from grouping
Returns:

returns B matrix for grouping
Return type:

numpy.array
research.master.create_g(a, evec)¶

Sort elements and corresponding rows to g1 or g2 based on whether or not the first eigenvector of the row is positive or negative.

Parameters:
  • a (numpy.array) – parent matrix
  • evec (numpy.array) – set of eigenvectors for matrix a
Returns:

both sets of order and arrays (g1, g2)
Return type:

list of int, list of int, list of int, list of int
research.master.create_g_matrix(order, arrays)¶

Given a set of element numbers and rows, build a new group.

Parameters:
  • order (list) – row elements
  • arrays (list) – rows for elements
Returns:

returns new matrix G assembled from order and arrays
Return type:

numpy.array

research.master.create_q(size, b, order, m)¶

Retrieve Q value from given order of elements and information from parent matrix.

Parameters:
  • size (int) – size from parent matrix
  • b (numpy.array) – B matrix from parent matrix
  • order (list of int) – order of elements from grouping (g1, g2)
  • m (numpy.array) – m from parent matrix
Returns:

first element of resulting matrix which is our Q value
Return type:

float
research.master.loadtxt(filename, save=True, stripe=True, blank=False)¶

Used to prep and convert text file of bitstrings to numpy compressed archive.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) –
  • save (bool) – save results to numpy archive, else return matrix, default is True
  • stripe (bool) – uh oh, this does nothing, woops
  • blank (bool) – remove blank objects (rows & cols)
Returns:

return matrix if not saving to archive
Return type:

numpy.array
research.master.remove_blanks(mat)¶

Remove blank objects (rows & cols) from matrix.

Parameters:mat (numpy.array) –
Returns:return matrix with blank objects removed
Return type:numpy.array
research.master.split(filename, initial=False, optimize=False)¶

Split the parent matrix into two separate groupings. Can be used for the initial split (master matrix) or subsequent groupings.

Parameters:
  • filename (str) –
  • initial (bool) – True to perform duties for initial split, default is False
  • optimize (bool) – (currently) gather information on optimization results, default is True
Returns:

if initial and optimize are True returns sorted list of optimization results, otherwise return two Parts for information regarding g1 and g2
Return type:

[list of tuples (int, float, float) | Part, Part]
research.master.temp_split(filename)¶

Splits information on a temporary basis for debugging. Used for node/tree summary. Does not perform checks present in normal split method.

Parameters:filename (str) –
Returns:returns two Part objects containing information for debugging
Return type:Part, Part
